Inside the Inside Label: A Comparison

09 Nov 2012

Here’s a snapshot of two different clothing labels I found on the inside of my 5 year olds’ clothing.

The first is from the Patagonia jacket I invested in to keep her warm all winter long. What does this label say to you? Here’s a clue–they expect the jacket to be handed down, so they offer two places for children’s names to be written. (Can we all do a collective awwwwwwww!)

The second is from a fancy-shmancy store, the new Lululemon kids’ store Ivivva Athletica in Oakville that my darling mother (my kids’ granny) schlepped them to when were were on vacation, because she’s a fashionista.

What does this label tell you? And remember, it’s a five year old’s garment.

Can you just picture my five year old on a hot pink glittery cell phone:

Pippa: “You mean the pink top? Yeah it’s mine. I’ll be right over on my scooter!”

I leave it to you to assess the values embedded in these clothing labels. But it’s worth noting that both brands are taking every opportunity to make an impression–it’s just that the impression they make is dramatically different.
